item.title: A Rare Hazard
item.description: In the first episode of the Second Season, we will have a closure for events of the previous episode, with right to terrorism and espionage.

item.title: Glacier Plains
item.description: The Glacier Plains is a region on the north-easternmost part of the OverWorld.

item.title: Malvadine
item.description: Malvadine is an Elite Warrior of the Mipedian Tribe.

item.title: Maxxor
item.description: Maxxor is an OverWorld Hero and the ruler of the OverWorld Tribe

item.title: Perithon!
item.description: In this episode, after an intense battle and glorious victory over the M’arrillians, the Tribes decide to keep Tribal Alliance towards a prosperous Perim and, to celebrate the peace, they make a car race… but old habits die hard…

item.title: Takinom
item.description: Takinom is an UnderWorld Commander who serves Chaor as one of his Counsellors, along with Agitos.

item.title: Wamma
item.description: Wamma is a Danian Mandiblor and the most iconic Creature of his Tribe

item.title: Welcome to Chaotic (Part 1)
item.description: In the first episode of the series, the protagonist, Tom Majors, receives his access code for Chaotic, a place where, according to his best friend, Kaz, you can turn into the Creatures and play for real.

item.title: Dangers of Diplomacy
item.description: In this episode we’ll see that it’s easier to get ants with honey than with vinegar, but that too much honey might not be a very good idea either.

item.title: Lake Ken-I-Po
item.description: The Lake Ken-I-Po is a region on the central-south part of the OverWorld.

item.title: Najarin
item.description: Najarin is an OverWorld Muge who serves Maxxor along with Intress as one of his Counsellors.

item.title: Nauthilax
item.description: Nauthilax is an UnderWorld Elementalist and a maritime spy to his Tribe

item.title: Welcome to Chaotic (Part 2)
item.description: In continuation of the series, after entering his access code, Tom discovers that all of Kaz’s fantasies were real and has his first battle in Chaotic.

item.title: Worlds Apart
item.description: In this episode we’ll meet Jycella, Krystella’s twin sister, and we’ll see that the bad relationship between them, common among humans, also happens in Perim, with the twin sisters Aivenna and Nivenna.

item.title: Zhade
item.description: Zhade is a Mipedian Stalker and an infiltrator agent of his Tribe

item.title: Blazier
item.description: Blazier is an OverWorld Scout and the cartographer of his Tribe.

item.title: H'earring
item.description: H’earring is an UnderWorld Scout and great small a spy for his Tribe.

item.title: Kickin' Bot
item.description: In this episode, Perim’s Dr. Frankenstein decides to implement part of his own brain in the Gigantroopers, making them intelligent enough to try to take over the Underworld, resulting in a battle in the best Pacific Rim style.

item.title: Prince Mudeenu
item.description: Prince Mudeenu is a Mipedian Royal and the next in line of succession of his Tribe

item.title: The Floundering Father
item.description: In this episode we’ll see a blabbermouth knows-it-all father getting real after a quadruple challenge.

item.title: UnderWorld City
item.description: The UnderWorld City is the sinister capital of the UnderWorld

item.title: Unexpected
item.description: In this episode we’ll meet the fourth member of the group, Peyton, and his… “eccentric”, personality

item.title: Chaor
item.description: Chaor is an UnderWorld Conqueror and the Warrior ruler of the UnderWorld Tribe

item.title: Colosseum Showdown
item.description: In this episode we’ll see a small misunderstanding end up in an epic way in the best Real Steel style.

item.title: Crystal Cave
item.description: The Crystal Cave is a region on the south-westernmost part of the OverWorld.

item.title: Heptadd
item.description: Heptadd is a powerful Guardian and a Muge of the OverWorld

item.title: Hotekk's Challenge (Part 1)
item.description: In this episode, Tom wins the seventh battle in the Hotekk Drome, and thus is challenged by the CodeMaster himself.

item.title: Over-Under Rent Asunder
item.description: The ancient war between Good vs. Evil in the Chaotic universe: OverWorld vs. UnderWorld.

item.title: Crash Course
item.description: In this episode, Kaz faces Klay in a dispute while Tom tries to get the scan of a lunatic Creature whose life is playing tricks.

item.title: Hotekk's Challenge (Parte 2)
item.description: In this episode, after winning CodeMaster Hotekk in a very intelligent way, Tom gets very disappointed with his reward… until he and his friends discover that a desert and not very interesting Location is actually much more than it looks (really!)

item.title: Riverlands
item.description: The Riverlands is a big region on the south-southwest part of the OverWorld.

item.title: Rockwave and Roll
item.description: In this episode we’ll see a match between Peyton and his musical idol, with rights to a subtle tribute to one of KISS’ lead singer Gene Simmons.

item.title: Tartarek
item.description: Tartarek is an OverWorld Hero and the head of the spy network head of his Tribe

item.title: Ulmar
item.description: Ulmar is an UnderWorld Conqueror and the mad scientist of his Tribe

item.title: Bodal
item.description: Bodal is an OverWorld Caretaker and the head Logistics Manager of his Tribe

item.title: Chaor's Commandos (Part 1)
item.description: In this episode we’ll see an elite squad led by Chaor in a bold raid on Kiru City towards the Overworld Arsenal.

item.title: Lava Pond
item.description: The Lava Pond is a region on the south-southwest part of the UnderWorld.

item.title: Magmon
item.description: Magmon is an UnderWorld Elementalist descendant of the ruler of his Tribe back in the times of Ancient Perim

item.title: The Thing About Bodal
item.description: In this episode we’ll meet Bodal, a Creature very talkative, annoying and cocky about himself.

item.title: Yesterday's Heroes
item.description: In this episode we’ll meet Vlar, a thief renegade by the OverWorld Tribe of Ancient Perim which, possibly, is Maxxor ancestor.

item.title: Buggin' Out
item.description: In this episode we’ll know another of the four Tribes in Chaotic, the Danians, a Tribe formed by insects of all kinds that take the safety of their domains seriously, especially when it comes to Chaotic players.

item.title: Chaor's Commandos (Part 2)
item.description: In the continuation of the previous episode we’ll see Chaor’s invasion to the Overworld Arsenal in Kiru City.

item.title: Dractyl
item.description: Dractyl is a terrifying flying Overworld Scout and a swift spy of his Tribe

item.title: Iron Pillar
item.description: The Iron Pillar is the central Pillar of the seven mighty Pillars holding the ceiling up in the UnderWorld

item.title: Losers' Circle
item.description: In this episode, Kaz is so psyched with his new scans from ancient Perim he decides to challenge every player who defeated him, thinking nobody would stand a chance… until his archenemy proves him otherwise.

item.title: A Gigantic Mission
item.description: In this episode we’ll see Vlar guiding Kiru and his fighters through the Temple of the ancient Gigantempopolis, when the giants were alive, in an attempt of dissuading Kaal to not invade Kiru City anymore, however, during the trip, the own future of the OverWorld was traced.

item.title: Everything's in Flux
item.description: In this episode we’ll know a little more about Krystella, a player as unprincipled as Klay that does everything, no matter what, to succeed or to prevent those who cross her path to succeed themselves.

item.title: Forest of Life
item.description: The Forest of Life is a region in the east-northeastern part of the OverWorld

item.title: Mega Match
item.description: In this episode we’ll see the internal competition between Kaz and Peyton to see who is the best Chaotic player get to a next level… only now it’s up to Tom.

item.title: Tangath Toborn
item.description: Tangath Toborn is a brave Warrior and wise a Strategist of the OverWorld

item.title: Castle Bodhran or Bust (Part 1)
item.description: In this episode we’ll meet the story of Reginald Terrington, the problems in which he got himself and the friends’ group attempt to rescue him with a bet that could mean the end of the career in Chaotic of one of them.

item.title: Kiru City
item.description: Kiru City is the magnificent capital of the OverWorld

item.title: Threshold of Destruction
item.description: In this episode, once Dranakis Threshold’s secret leaked out, several players ported to ancient Perim, including Chaotic’s “Bonnie & Clyde”, who didn’t take long in conspiring with an old acquaintance, making of a painful event become, potentially, irreversible.

item.title: Time's Up
item.description: In this episode we’ll have a grayish, silent, “Futuresight” with a small and subtle spoiler of the Season’s apex.

item.title: A Peytonic Adventure
item.description: In this episode, an adventure in the 007 style in which Peyton is challenged by a world famous art counterfeiter for a Chaotic match.

item.title: Castle Bodhran or Bust (Part 2)
item.description: In the continuation of the previous episode, Tom comes face-to-face with his hero, but before he could even try to rescue Reggie, he must not only gain his trust but also fight a real battle against another Tribe along with his friends.

item.title: Gigantempopolis
item.description: In this episode we’ll meet Gigantempopolis, a desert place, full of mysteries, treasures and, of course, curses, in the best The Lord of the Rings style.

item.title: Mount Pillar
item.description: Mount Pillar is the Danian homeworld and one of the seven mighty Pillars holding the ceiling up in the UnderWorld

item.title: Elementary
item.description: In this episode we’ll meet the four Elemental Servants of the Lost City and a battle in Chaotic with them all at once.

item.title: Lord of Treachery
item.description: In this episode, we’ll meet the treacherous Lord Van Bloot, second in command of the Underworld, and how Chaor makes of Kaz his spy and uses the Chaotic battles as a military strategy against him.

item.title: War Beasts
item.description: In this episode, after a while without mess with other players, Krystella and Klay set up for Peyton to get the scan of a War Beast, a humongous Mipedian titan as powerful as lunatic and, apparently, uncontrollable.

item.title: Battledrome of the Sexes
item.description: In this episode, we’ll discover (or not) who plays Chaotic better, men or women, boys or girls, in a fight between Peyton and Krystella.

item.title: From the Deep (Part 1)
item.description: In this episode, a mysterious Creature from a long forgotten past arises again with astonishing and disturbing revelations about the future of Perim.

item.title: Son of the Spiritlands
item.description: In this episode, an indestructible Creature from the Spiritlands threatens to destroy the whole Perim unless Tangath Toborn faces him.

item.title: Battle Lessons
item.description: In this episode Tom gets to know more about the main event in Chaotic: The CodeMasters Matches!

item.title: From the Deep (Part 2)
item.description: In the continuation of the previous episode, betrayal, brainwash, a military coup and the beginning of the end… Let the Invasion begin!

item.title: Tale of Two Toms
item.description: In this episode an easy-going version of our protagonist comes into play and, thanks to an evil pushing, ends up in a fight, in the best Chaotic style.

item.title: The Birth of Borth-Majar
item.description: In this episode we will know the origins of an unusual creature, Borth-Majar, and how Kaz handles their individual personalities and (almost) collective mind.

item.title: Blight Fight
item.description: In this episode we’ll meet Garv, the OverWorld Caretaker in charge of Lake Morn, helping Tom (and Smildon) to heal the Prexxor Chasm from the Blight instead of fighting it by brute-force.

item.title: Shifting Sands
item.description: In this episode Peyton shows to Tom that not all of the Mipedians are cruel and pitiless as those he met while rescuing Reggie.

item.title: Fallen Hero
item.description: In this episode we’ll see a treacherous coup of Lord Van Bloot against Maxxor that could destroy the OverWorld.

item.title: Newbie
item.description: In this episode we’ll meet Shinwan, a newcomer headstrong enough to be the first in Chaotic to get a M’arrillian scan.

item.title: Putting the Muge in Mugic
item.description: In this episode we’ll have a common (and unnecessary) territorial war complete with treason, sabotage, counter-espionage and lessons of leadership between OverWorlders and Mipedians.

item.title: Scavenger Scan
item.description: In this episode we’ll see Kaz and Peyton competing with each other (again) to see who is the best player of Chaotic between them.

item.title: Allmageddon
item.description: In this episode we’ll know the story of Hoton, a Creature that, seeking for an ancient power to protect everything and everyone he loved, ended up losing everything.

item.title: Mister E
item.description: In this episode we’ll see more about the power of the M’arrillians and the beginning of one of the possible futures shown in “Time’s Up”.

item.title: A Fearsome Fate
item.description: In the previous episodes, Tom finally got a new scan of his favorite Creature, Maxxor, but when he used it for the first time in battle he realizes that something is wrong.

item.title: When a CodeMaster Calls
item.description: In this episode we’ll see Peyton going on a journey into M’arrillian territory in name of CodeMaster Hotekk in order to become his apprentice… said no one ever.

item.title: Earth to Kaz
item.description: In this episode we’ll see Kaz’s passion for Chaotic becoming a problem for him when he needs to prove to the psychologist of his school that Chaotic is a real place o.O

item.title: Maze of Menace
item.description: In this episode, continuing the sequence in which the Commander of the Otherworld, Maxxor, was ambushed by Lord Van Bloot’s treacherous Mugic, we’ll see a partnership between Creatures and humans to restore the Fallen Hero before it’s too late.

item.title: Out in the Cold
item.description: In this episode we’ll see Kaz’s journey through a dangerous path, with an unusual guidance, to the aid of the reclusive Raimusa in the Crystal Range.

item.title: Raznus Returns
item.description: In this episode, a problematic excavation leads some Mandiblors led by Odu-Bathax and Raznus, former OverWorld Ambassador to the Danians, now Assimilated, to the basement of the Arsenal of OverWorld.

item.title: Chaotikings
item.description: In this episode we’ll see Kaz’s initiation in the most famous “club” in Chaotic… or not.

item.title: Warriors of Eternity
item.description: In this episode, Sarah is attacked by a Mipedian ghost and her friends, while searching for her, join a group of Mipedians who are searching for the legendary Owayki and his Stone Warriors, immune to the M’arrillian’s mind control.

item.title: Stelgar Strikes
item.description: In this episode we’ll meet Mommark, a mad scientist from the OverWorld, and one of his creations, Stelgar.

item.title: UnderWorld Overthrown
item.description: In this episode we’ll see Chaor and his loyal fighters execute a battle plan against the M’arrillians in the Marsh of Murk.

item.title: The CodeMaster Chronicles (Part 1)
item.description: In this episode we’ll see the first part of the most amazing match in Chaotic: The battle between Tom Majors and the CodeMaster Crellan!

item.title: Triple Threat
item.description: In this episode we’ll see the Tribal Alliance overcoming its cultural differences so they united may have a chance against the M’arrillians.

item.title: Last Stand (Part 1)
item.description: In this episode, the beginning of the end… the battle for Perim is now!

item.title: The CodeMaster Chronicles (Part 2)
item.description: In continuation of the previous episode, after having his battle plan ruined because of the mighty Cromaxx, Tom needs to figure out a way to workaround the situation in this epic battle.

item.title: Last Stand (Part 2)
item.description: In this episode, the battle continues in different regions of Perim at once… and in the Tribal Alliance itself as well.

item.title: The Ultimate Scan
item.description: In this episode we’ll know a bit about a mythical Creature called Iparu and its fantastic abilities.

item.title: An Easy Win
item.description: In this episode we’ll see how things can get really ugly when we try to take advantage of a rookie, right Peyton?

item.title: Legions of Aa'une (Season Finale)
item.description: In this episode, the battle continues with overturns and some shifting… and the end!

item.title: A Flux Too Far
item.description: In this episode we’ll see Kaz and Peyton trying to get a scan of the Flux Bauble… or not.

item.title: Chaotic Crisis
item.description: In this episode, the Creatures of Chaotic invade Earth! Let’s get Chaotic… for our planet!

item.title: The Curse of Kor-Bek
item.description: In this episode, set in one of the islands of the archipelago Peyton and Kaz ended up in the episode “A Flux Too Far”, we’ll have pirates, buried treasures, curses and chasing.

item.title: Fire Fighters
item.description: In this episode we’ll see a hot fight, literally, in which both players will try to prove their own superiority as well as of one of of the Four Elements.

item.title: Chasm Quest
item.description: In this episode Tom finally decides to explore the Prexxor Chasm, in Perim, from the scan he got from CodeMaster Crellan until he realizes that something is really wrong.

item.title: Train Wreck
item.description: In this episode, when Kaz starts getting trouble in Chaotic, Peyton helps him with a… “personal trainer”.

item.title: Trading Cards
item.description: In this episode we’ll see a card trading chain engineered by Sarah so she could have the scan of rare Mugic. Of course our gentlemen wouldn’t let her down… right?

item.title: Dual Duel (Part 1)
item.description: In this episode we’ll see Krystella and Klay up to no good (again), resulting in an interesting dual battle for the scan of a wicked Battlegear.

item.title: Dual Duel (Part 2)
item.description: In the continuation of the previous episode, we’ll not only see the ending of the battle in midst of Krystella and Klay’s mental games. And that, well, karma is a bitch ¯\_(ツ)_/¯

item.title: Going Under
item.description: In this episode we’ll see a small part of one of the most known teachings of Sun Tzu’s The Art of War in Chaotic: Know your enemy!

item.title: Big Time
item.description: In this episode we’ll see Sarah’s quest to get the scan of a rare and powerful winged Danian that ends up on her frustrating a kidnapping attempt by an enemy Tribe.

item.title: Eye of the Maelstrom
item.description: In this episode, Tom and his friends will help Najarin and a group of Mipedians in an important mission and that trust is a gift, not a right.

item.title: Fighting Friendly (Season Finale)
item.description: In this episode… the end! Of the season, of a promising career and of a long time friendship…

item.title: Card Search
item.description: Tell us more about the Card (s) you have in mind and we’ll sneak into Najarin’s Castle to bring some information for you.

item.title: Current Version
item.description:
Added

Structure-related changes

  • Added a missing i18n entry for Tangath Toborn, In Training

  • Added a Content File to ease out the development of a 404 Page, even though, for now, after compiled, the resulting has to be manually renamed and moved one level above

item.title: Glacier Plains, M'arrillian Heat Cannon
item.description: Google Images M’arrillian Heat Cannon Region OverWorld Rarity Super Rare Initiative Number of Mugicians   If the ice melts, Perim will die. We must stop it... no matter the sacrifice... Tangath Toborn In the Animation, during the apex of the M’arrillian Invasion, the M’arrillians succeeds building their heat cannon and start melting the mountains on Glacier Plains.

item.title: Glacier Plains, M’arrillian Melting Camp
item.description: Google Images M’arrillian Melting Camp Region OverWorld Rarity Ultra Rare Initiative Fluidmorpher   In order to accomplish their goal of flooding all of Perim, making a big ocean out of it, the M’arrillians settled down a camp so they could build the heat cannon to melt the ice mountains. The Mugical aura of the Glacier Plains feels this disturbance and unless a sacrifice is paid, in the form of Mugicians, the trespassers will be severally penalized by having all of their Attributes cut-off by 50 points each.

item.title: Lake Ken-I-Po, Ritual Site
item.description: Google Images Lake Ken-I-Po, Ritual Site Region OverWorld Rarity Rare Initiative Number of Elements   As the towers emerged, all wondered what more lay below the surface The Ascension of Kaizeph is more than just the emergence of the City of Elements to the skies of Perim, it’s a ritual occurring in Lake Ken-I-Po.

item.title: Lava Pond, Milla'iin's Foothold
item.description: Google Images Lava Pond Milla'iin's Foothold Region UnderWorld Rarity Rare Initiative Power   In the Animation, during the M’arrillian Invasion, in order to maximize the flooding caused by the melting of the frozen mountains of the Glacier Plains, Perim had to be partially reshaped. Milla’iin, a M’arrillian Chieftain, established a foothold in the Lava Pond commanding Khybon, the first of the Creatures Phelphor successfully brainwashed, to build enormous pipes on the East walls of the Lava Pond in order to inundate everything with the waters of Everrain.

item.title: Najarin, High Muge of the Lake
Prince Mudeenu, Champion of the Guard
Rao'Pa Sahkk
item.description:
• Chimegrid
            • The Ocean with no Water

Rao’Pa Sahkk

item.title: Rao'Pa Sahkk, the Ocean with no Water
rev. 0e10d1c
item.description:
Added

Structure-related changes

  • Added an i18n for Sílvio Giraldi as the second Brazilian Portuguese Voice Actor of Xaerv

  • Added Faduli Costha as the second Brazilian Portuguese Voice Actor of Siado

  • Added Sidney Lilla as the third Brazilian Portuguese Voice Actor of Khybon

  • Added Luiz Antônio Lobue as the Brazilian Portuguese Voice Actor of Valanii Levaan, although, at least for now, only for Episode #28, Season #01

  • Added Mauro Castro as Voice Actor of Prince Mudeenu in Episode #18, Season #01 (Brazilian Portuguese only)

  • With the recent identification of the second Brazilian Portuguese Voice Actor of Siado, the entry appearances in his Data File has been added

  • Added i18n for the texts Copy and Copied as well for the “title” in the Sharing Menu

item.title: rev. 18ba4b7
item.description:
Added

Hugo Templates-related changes
  • Added a solid coloured border around the Advertisement Blocks to make them visible while on Development Mode since Google AdSense blocks them to be rendered locally
Public Content-related changes

  • Added a second “in-ads” advertisement block in the published Article about Najarin since it is very long and thus comport without forcing too much

  • Published the Episode #21, Season #01 with Brazilian Portuguese audio

item.title: rev. 2977172
item.description:
Added

Structure-related changes

  • Applied Content File Componentization to the Changelog Page with i18n entries and additional CSS/JS files to hide most of the contents in a collapsible block

  • Added our Github Account as another value of sameAs Property for Schema.org’s Organization Entity

  • Added Content Files, Data Files and i18n entries for the following Pages as a counterpart of the references made in the Article about Iron Pillar published in this revision: Gigantroper (Battlegear) and Ice Pillar, Jade Pillar, Jagged Pillar, Steam Pillar, Stone Pillar and Wooden Pillar (Locations)

  • Added an even better way to display the expanded text of <abbr> tags on mobile

item.title: rev. 33fd090
item.description:
Added

Structure-related changes
  • Added new Content Files and i18n entries to the following references made in the Article published in this revision: Mipedian Cactus (Battlegear), Donmar (OverWorlder), Taffial (Mipedian), Tharc (Danian), Tablet Sanctuary (Location) and Thunder Shout, Turbulence Funnel e Whirling Wail (Attacks)
Hugo Templates-related changes
  • Added a new Shortcode Template expr to allow bold expressions used for idiomatic expressions (Shortcode lang) to be distinguished from simple expressions while keeping their own HTML attributes lang and xml:lang

item.title: rev. 3cf8783
item.description:
Added

Structure-related changes

  • Applied Content File Componentization to the published Articles about Maxxor and Najarin

  • Added componentizable Content File, with their own Data Files and i18n entries, about the following Creatures’ variations: Maxxor, Protector of Perim; Najarin, Fluidmorphers’ Foe; Najarin, High Muge of the Lake; and Najarin, Younger

  • Added Content Files, Data Files and i18n entries for the following Pages as counterpart of the many changes made in the published Article about Najarin: Flame Breach and Fluid Flame (Attacks), Anthem of Stone, Battlesong of Renewal, Chorus of Cothica, Dissonance of Will, Ecstatic Fanfare, Howl of the Wind, Intertwined Melody and Song of Revival (Mugics) and Muge’s Tuningfork (Battlegear)

  • Added Content Files, Data Files and i18n entries for the following Pages as counterpart of the many changes made in the componentizable Article about Najarin, Fluidmorphers’ Foe: Heptagon Hail (Attack), Rao’Pa Sahkk Chimegrid (Location), Dissonance of Distraction, Requiem of Lost Minds and Requiem of Fear (Mugics) and Mipedian Balladeers’ Flute (Battlegear)

  • Added Content Files, Data Files and i18n entries for the following Pages as counterpart of the many changes made in the componentizable Article about Najarin, High Muge of the Lake: Glacial Balls (Attack), Fluid Fugue (Mugic), Arrthoa, Enre-hep, Kopond and Lore (Creatures)

  • Added Content Files, Data Files and i18n entries for the following Pages as counterpart of the many changes made in the componentizable Article about Najarin, Younger: Dibanni (Creature), Song of Deflection and Fighters’ Fanfare (Mugic)

  • Added Content Files, Data Files and i18n entries for the following Pages as counterpart of the references made in the Article about Wamma published in this revision: Ash Torrent and Magma Might (Attacks), Silchaw’s Mine (Location), Chorus of the Hive and Draining Dirge (Mugics) and Aszil, the Young Queen; Illexia, the Danian Queen; Wamma, Hive Ordnance; and Wamma, Flame Guard; (Creatures)

item.title: rev. 482384e
item.description:
Added

Structure-related changes

  • Added, as counterparts of the references made in the Article about the Forest of Life published in this revision, Content Files, Data Files and i18n entries for Slowsand (Attack), Reality Field Generator (Battlegear), Psimion, Abin-wor, Bivike; Grantkae, Mipedian General; Jorre, Mipedian Lieutenant; and Noaz, Mipedian Cavalerist (Creatures); and Tune of Xerium (Mugic)

  • Added componentizable Content Files, with their own Data Files and i18n entries to the following Pages added as references for the Article about the Forest of Life published in this revision: Ikkatosh, Guardian of Nature and Ikkatosh, the Aich King (Creatures); and Forest of Life, During Aichlyys, Mipedim Oasis, Aichlyys Festival and Rao’Pa Sahkk, the Ocean with no Water (Locations)

  • Added a new Page about Rao’Pa Sahkk to concentrate all variants of this Location through multiple componentizable Articles

item.title: rev. 4c972b7
item.description:
Added

Structure-related changes

  • Added missing FrontMatter Parameters to describe pictures’ height and width of most Content Files

  • Added the newly implemented attribute picture for the “Card” Shortcode with the path to the images used. Even though they’re the same as the FrontMatter Parameter picture.path this opens the possibility for a future update to expand the currently used “Picture” Shortcode for Cards’ variations with the “Card” Shortcode, providing more information to be parsed by the Card Search

  • Added the newly implemented FrontMatter Parameters to disable Facebook Comments Plugin and to prevent Google Analytics to be included in the following Content Files: Category Pages (Attacks, Battlegears, Locations, Mugics and Creatures), Sub-categories Pages (OverWorld, UnderWorld, Mipedians, Danians, M’arrillians, Tribeless) and Disclaimer Page

item.title: rev. 5888ab9
item.description:
Added

Structure-related changes

  • Added an external plugin to handle the Clipboard, allowing texts to be copied to it

  • Added Bootstrap Modal Component as part of the new method of Sharing Article/Pages

  • Added Content Files _index.<LANG>.md under /changelog in order to enable it as a Hugo Section as part of the new implementation of Changelog Pages (see below)

item.title: rev. 6049e99
item.description:
Added

Structure-related changes

  • After a revision made to the FrontMatter Parameters infrastructure, the Parameters listed and comentable which, respectively, prevents an Article to be listed and allows it to be discussed through Facebook Comments Plugin, have been added, both set as false, in all published componentizable Articles of Locations variants

  • After a revision made to the FrontMatter Parameters infrastructure, all Pages related to a top-level in Navigation Menu (i.e. Perim) received in their _index.<LANG>.md files a new Parameter named category

  • After a revision made to the FrontMatter Parameters infrastructure, all Pages related to a sub-level in the Navigation Menu (i.e. Attacks) received in their /<SUBFOLDER>/_index.<LANG>.md files a new Parameter named category, overwriting their parent’s -AND- an additional Parameter named subcategory with the same effect of the now removed group

item.title: rev. 7050f3c
item.description:
Added

Structure-related changes

  • With the internal structure change (see below), in order to make the Perim Category to work a Page with its own Custom URL had to be added listing all Card Types on it

  • And with the change above, an additional Breadcrumb Trail has been added to all Pages under the Perim Category pointing to the new Page created

  • Added i18n (internationalization) entries for the newly added Perim Listing Page and for the “Share on Facebook/Twitter” hover title change (see below)

  • Added a Hugo’s Compiler setting to prevent automatic pluralization of Section Titles, preventing, for example “Perims”, even though the corresponding i18n entry isn’t pluralized

item.title: rev. 7b09115
item.description:
Added

Structure-related changes

  • Added default values for the META Tags description if a Summary, the text before Hugo’s special markup more, hasn’t been defined -AND- if after replacing all HTML line-breaks (<br/>) with new-lines (\n) the resulting Summary is an empty string or with only non-printable characters. This way we ensure that all Pages, even those not effectively published yet due lack of real content has a value for the tag

  • Added Bing’s Authorization XML file so it can properly crawl the site because, apparently, Microsoft doesn’t know understand that, as of today, quotes around the HTML attributes of these tags and/or ending slash for self-closed tags are optional

Public Content-related changes

  • Added missing FrontMatter Parameter publishingDate to the published Articles about Magmon (Creature) and Lava Pond and Iron Pillar (Locations) and on each one of the componentizable revisions in the Changelog Page, even though such information will not be actually added on them while the revamped SEO implementation is not applied to the Videos’ Pages because of FrontMatter Parameter conflicts between them

  • Added missing FrontMatter Parameter group to the following published componentizable Articles: Bodal, Flamedrill Researcher; Maxxor, Protector of Perim; Najarin, High Muge of the Lake; Najarin, Younger; Takinom, the Shadowknight; Wamma, Flame Guard; and Wamma, Hive Ordnance

  • Added missing FrontMatter Parameter group to the published componentizable Article about Najarin, Fluidmorphers’ Foe (Brazilian Portuguese only)

  • Added missing FrontMatter Parameters publishingDate -AND- group to the following published componentizable Articles: Glacier Plains, M’arrillian Melting Camp; Glacier Plains, M’arrillian Heat Cannon; Lake Ken-I-Po, Ritual Site; Riverlands, Abandoned Wastes; Riverlands, Erak’tabb’s Foothold; UnderWorld City, During Van Bloot Ascension; and Lava Pond, Milla’iin’s Foothold (Locations) and Magmon, Retaliator; and Magmon, Engulfed (Creatures)

item.title: rev. 8f9025f
item.description:
Added

Structure-related changes

  • Added Content Files, Data Files and i18n entries for: Rainspears (Attack); Fanfare of the Vanishing (Mugic); Nexus Fuse and Wind Whip (Battlegears); Iflar, the Crown Prince; Marquis Darini; Na-inna and Siado (Creatures) as counterparts of the references made in the Article about the Prince Mudeenu published in this revision

  • With the expansion on Data Files for Videos model (see below), new JSON files have been added, one for each episode in both languages currently available

item.title: rev. 90ab401
item.description:
Added

Structure-related changes

  • Implemented something to cover possible uncertainties regarding Voice Actors with another entry named verified along to the name of each Voice Actor identified listed in the cast FrontMatter Parameter. If this entry is defined for that Voice Actor -AND- set as false a little superscript number is added next to the Voice Actor name

  • Added a default value through a recently added i18n entry for cases in which no Voice Actor has been identified for a listed Character

  • Added the missing FrontMatter Parameters section and group in the Terms of Use Content File (Brazilian Portuguese only)

  • Added a Hugo’s Compiler setting to prevent the so-called Fast Render Mode to be used by default. Just a little something to speed-up the server initialization while developing

  • Added the FrontMatter Parameter show with the new format of Season and Episode in all applicable Content Files

  • Added i18n (internationalization) entries for the newly added Pages: Bierk, Zapetur, Kaal and The Pits

item.title: rev. a20738d
item.description:
Added

Structure-related changes
  • Added Content Files, Data Files and i18n entries for the following Pages as counterpart of the references made in the Article about Magmon published in this revision: Fireram (Attack), Whepcrack (Battlegear) and Kreaal; Magmon; Retaliator and Magmon, Engulfed (Creatures);
Hugo Templates-related changes

  • Added an empty element to the bottom of the Card Information Box with the same colour of the Card Type / Tribe, visually closing the box

  • Added a condition to the Card Information Template to -NOT- show the Biography Header if there’s nothing to show under it

item.title: rev. a42c3fc
item.description:
Added

Structure-related changes

  • Added Content Files, Data Files and i18n entries for: Lake Blakeer; The Hive Gallery; The Infectorium; Lore’s Chamber of Recall; Oipont’s Lookout; OverWorld Embassy at Mount Pillar; Queen’s Gate; Mount Pillar Reservoir, Neth’uar’s Foothold; and Mount Pillar Reservoir, Liberated (Locations); Iparu and Kinnianne (Creatures, OverWorld); Ajara and Kolmo (Creatures, Mipedians); Ghundac; Katharaz; Klencka; Klencka, Avenger; Makromil, Nakal; Odu-Bathax, Reservoir Reclaimer; Valanii Levaan; and Yondaf (Creatures, Danians) as counterparts of the references made in the Article about the Mount Pillar published in this revision.

  • Added A Flux too Far as one of the Episodes in which the Forest of Life appeared in the Animation (Brazilian Portuguese only)

item.title: rev. b9c13d9
item.description:
Added

Structure-related changes

  • Added Visual Studio Code Workspace file to the .gitignore file

  • Added an attribute title for the dynamically generated <iframe> used on Videos Pages as suggested by Google Lighthouse

  • Added all of the required Bootstrap Components individually instead of minifying them all manually

Hugo Templates-related changes
  • Added the META Tag Description (a.k.a. Summary) for the Listing Pages in the SEO implementation

item.title: rev. bb9e032
item.description:
Added

Structure-related changes

  • Added Content Files, Data Files and i18n entries for the following Pages as a counterpart of the references made in the Article about Tangath Toborn published in this revision: Deadwater Devastation, Degenervate, Fearless Strike, Grounding Grapple, Primal Smash and Unified Tribecharge (Attacks); Burithean Axe (Battlegear); and Aimukk; Faash; Gorram, Danian General; Tassanil; Drimesse; Fivarth; Ghatup; Savell; Nebres; Targubaj; Viqtarr; Lyssta; Rothar and Ultadur (Creatures)

  • Added missing i18n entry for Tartarek

item.title: rev. bd1784c
item.description:
Added

Structure-related changes

  • Added i18n entries to describe Locations in the OverWorld and UnderWorld in order to make it easier for the Templating logics to build i18n keys for them

  • Added Data Files to all existing Creatures published so far, with their attributes, traits, episodes and voice actors

  • With the Content Files Componentization applied to the published Articles about Locations (see below), new i18n entries have been added for each one of them

item.title: rev. c228435
item.description:
Added

Structure-related changes

  • Added a custom sorting feature of the Characters listed in Episodes Cast through a new entry weight

  • Added new i18n entries with the Voice Actors of the following Characters: Sarah, Klay (by associating him with Chaor’s Voice Actor), Krystella, “HercuLeon”, “SlickNick”, CodeMaster Crellan, Tiaane (by associating him with Heptadd’s Voice Actor), Xaerv (by associating him with Magmon’s Voice Actor), Dractyl, Vidav, Agitos, Skithia and two possible Voice Actors (although one of them hasn’t been confirmed and, therefore, not used) to Owis (English only)

  • Added new i18n entries with the Voice Actors of the following Characters: Sarah, Peyton, Klay, Krystella, CodeMaster Crellan (real and “human form”), Zalic and Gespedan (by associating them with Zalic’s Voice Actor) and Xaerv (Brazilian Portuguese only)

item.title: rev. cc4406c
item.description:
Added

Structure-related changes

  • Added the HTML entity   to all almost all empty tags preventing them to be really empty and therefore considered as removal candidates by HTML Minifiers

  • Added a different error message to Card Search, allowing one of the two fatal errors that could yield no results while using the Card Search to be better distinguished

  • Added an entry to the .gitignore wrongly removed in previous commits

  • Added the SiteNavigationElement Structured Data pointing to the Navigation Menu as another SEO improvement

  • Published Episode #15, Season #01 with Brazilian Portuguese audio

item.title: rev. d75e5c1
item.description:
Added

Structure-related changes

  • Added componentizable Content File, with their own Data Files and i18n entries, about the following Creatures’ variations: Blazier, Citadel Cartographer; Tartarek, Psi-Overloader; Chaor, The Fierce; H’earring, Tainted; Nauthilax, Tainted; and Nauthilax, Aquatic Spy

  • Added Content Files, Data Files and i18n entries for Reefshard (Battlegear) as a counterpart of the reference made in the recently componentized Article about Tartarek, Psi-Overloader

  • Added Content Files, Data Files and i18n entries for Decrescendo (Mugic) because, well, the artwork was too beautiful to pass :p

  • Added an i18n entry for César Marchetti as the second Brazilian Portuguese Voice Actor of Staluk

  • Added Data Files for the identified voices of Ettala, Gespedan Mommark, Staluk and Klasp (Brazilian Portuguese only) and Owis (all Languages)

  • With the recently identified voices, in order to show the “On TV” box, the following Data Files under TV Appearance have been added: Ettala, Gespedan, Mommark, Owis, Staluk and Klasp

  • Added Content Files, Data Files and i18n entries for Mommark and Klasp as a counterpart of the recently identified Voice Actors

item.title: rev. dff4edc
item.description:
Added

Structured-related changes
  • Added i18n (internationalization) entries for the new Content Files added (see below)
New Content Files
  • Added Content Files, Data Files and i18n entries for the following Pages as a counterpart of the references made in the Article about Tartarek: Lavalanche and Megaroar (Attacks); Gauntlets of Might and Indigo Sash (Battlegears) and Vinta, Rath’tab and Fal’makin (Creatures)

item.title: rev. e05de27
item.description:
Added

Structure-related changes

  • Added a new i18n entry for Drew’s (Battleboarder) Voice Actor, a secondary character from Episode Allmageddon (Brazilian Portuguese only)

  • Added a new i18n entry for Blügon’s Voice Actor (Brazilian Portuguese only)

  • Added a new i18n entry for Cerbie’s Voice Actor (English only)

  • Added new Content Files and i18n entries for the Underworld Creatures Cerbie and Drakness, much to give more context for their recently discovered Brazilian Portuguese Voice Actors

item.title: rev. ef7cc2b
item.description:
Added

Structure-related changes

  • Added Content Files, Data Files and i18n entries for the following Pages as a counterpart of the references made in the Article about Kiru City published in this revision: The OverWorld Library and The Training Grounds (Locations); and Drabe, Hune Paltanin and Raznus, Assimilated (Creatures)

  • Added ESLint’s Configuration file

Public Content-related changes
  • Published Article about Kiru City

item.title: rev. f7f9cbb
item.description:
Added

Structure-related changes
  • Added Content Files, Data Files and i18n entries for the following Pages as a counterpart of the references made in the Article about Dractyl published in this revision: Alacritous Force, Frost Blight and Power Pulse (Attacks) and Dread Tread, Elixir of Tenacity and Obliterators (Battlegears)
Hugo Templates-related changes

  • When using Hugo’s Content Minifier to optimize the output of all HTML files, we realized that all double quotes around the values of HTML attributes were also removed. While browsers understand this as valid, for some reason, this yielded several “unsecured domain” errors while making the required AJAX calls of the Card’s Search Tool, regardless of the fact of both the Requester (Tool’s Page) and the requested (each Page fitting the query filter, if any) be in the same domain and under SSL. In order to prevent that to happen, we created a new Shortcode called href that simply runs Hugo’s absURL function over a given argument. This would make our form action /tags/ to become https://www.chaoticonline.ml/tags/

  • Added a Partial Template to use Facebook Page Plugin, on hold until further testing

item.title: rev. f8841d8
item.description:
Added

Structure-related changes

  • Applied Content File Componentization to the published Articles about Ulmar, Malvadine and Zhade

  • Added componentizable Content File, with their own Data Files and i18n entries, about the following Creatures’ variations: Ulmar, Wavescrambler; Ulmar, Perithon Racer; Malvadine, The King’s Herald; and Zhade, Dig Site Defender

  • Added componentizable Content Files, with its own Data Files and i18n entry about Ulmanator as a counterpart of the reference made in the recently componentized Article about Ulmar

item.title: rev. fcd9167
item.description:
Added

Structure-related changes

  • Implemented Content File Componentization in the published Article about Takinom and Bodal as BETA feature using the improved Include Shortcode, putting the subsection about Takinom, The Shadowknight and Bodal, Flamedrill Researcher on its own Page. This way not only main Articles will be shorter after the live testing period but all Cards’ variations will appear in a Cards Search results because every one of them will have their own URL

  • Added an optional FrontMatter Parameter listed through which it’s possible to remove an Article/Page from Listings without remove it from the site

  • Added Content Files about Takinom, the Shadowknight and Plasmarrow, as counterpart of the many changes made in the published Article about Takinom

  • Added Content Files and i18n entries for Takinom, the Shadowknight and Plasmarrow as, respectively, part of the Content File Componentization and counterpart of one of the changes in Article about Takinom

  • Added i18n entries for Disciplines, Elemental Affinities and some others more specific in order to have matches for Taxonomy Terms

  • Added the following Content Files and i18n entries referenced in the Article about Bodal published in this revision: Lucky Shot, Supercooled Rain and Viperlash (Attacks), Mount Pillar Reservoir, Gloomuck Swamp and Kiru City Tunnels (Locations), Bodal’s Dagger, Orchis Undis and Sandstorm Shroud (Battlegears) and Olkiex and Bodal, Flamedrill Researcher (Creatures)

item.title: rev. fee56ab
item.description:
Added

Structure-related changes

  • Added an hourglass SVG icon to represent the Temporary Allegiance of some Creatures with the M’arrillians

  • Added the FrontMatter Parameter isGroup to the Listing Page-Files /perim/creatures/_index.<LANG>.md after all they also are a “categories’ category”

item.title: Riverlands, Abandoned Wastes
item.description: Google Images Riverlands Abandoned Wastes Region OverWorld Rarity Common Initiative Fewest Elements   After the defeat of Aa’une, the remaining M’arrillians fled to the Doors of the Deepmines leaving all damage caused behind. The Riverlands became an ugly and desolated place… But in a collective effort, as seen during the events of Elementary, Rellim, the Riverlands’ Caretaker, Hune Canin, Najarin, Garv, Caretaker of Lake Morn and the Servant of Water, Unda, in an apparent visit to the OverWorld, succeeded in destroying all of M’arrillians’ dams and, the most important, purified the water so life could once again return to the region.

item.title: Riverlands, Erak'tabb's Foothold
item.description: Google Images Riverlands Erak'tabb's Foothold Region OverWorld Rarity Rare Initiative Wisdom   In the Animation, during the M’arrillian Invasion, in order to maximize the flooding caused by the melting of the frozen mountains of the Glacier Plains, Perim had to be partially reshaped and to do so the M’arrillians had to build dams in strategic locations.

item.title: UnderWorld City, During Van Bloot Ascension
item.description: Google Images Underworld City During Van Bloot Ascension Region UnderWorld Rarity Uncommon Initiative Courage   In the Animation, during the M’arrillian Invasion, while Chaor and a small group of loyal UnderWorlders were boldly trying to take down the M’arrillians by themselves in the Marsh of Murk, during the events of UnderWorld Overthrown, Lord Van Bloot, led an army of M’arrillians to the UnderWorld City, taking control of it by force in the name of his new master, Aa’une, and, thus, ascending as the new ruler of the UnderWorld.
